intro: Pseudoweinmannia, commonly known as the false weinmannia, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Cephalopodaceae. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their evergreen leaves and distinctive inflorescences. They are native to South America, particularly in regions of Brazil, Peru, and Bolivia. Pseudoweinmannia species often grow in tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in humid, well-drained soils. Their botanical significance lies in their unique floral structures and ecological roles within their native habitats.
